benchmark_details.name: MIBench
benchmark_details.overview: MIBench is designed to comprehensively evaluate fine-grained abilities of multimodal large language models (MLLMs) in multi-image scenarios across three scenarios: multi-image instruction, multimodal knowledge-seeking, and multimodal in-context learning, with a total of 13 tasks and 13,000 annotated samples.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive evaluation framework for assessing the multi-image abilities of MLLMs.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Due to the input length limitation of current MLLMs, the benchmark includes 2 to 8 input images in each sample.

data.source: Data constructed from various existing annotated datasets, including NLVR2, MagicBrush, VrR-VG, Something-Something V2, and others.
data.annotation: Manual annotation and automated filtering, supplemented with GPT-4 generated distractors.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated based on the predicted options from models against the correct options.
methodology.interpretation: A model is considered to have correctly answered a sample only if it consistently provides the correct response across multiple tests.
methodology.validation: Data quality ensured through automated filtering and manual verification.
